definition: a tubular organ in an aquatic animal (especially in mollusks) through which water can be taken in or expelled, move a liquid from one container into another by means of a siphon or a siphoning action
details:
noun
- a tubular organ in an aquatic animal (especially in mollusks) through which water can be taken in or expelled
= synonyms: syphon
- a tube running from the liquid in a vessel to a lower level outside the vessel so that atmospheric pressure forces the liquid through the tube
= synonyms: syphon
verb
- move a liquid from one container into another by means of a siphon or a siphoning action
= example: move a liquid from one container into another by means of a siphon or a siphoning action
- convey, draw off, or empty by or as if by a siphon
= synonyms: syphon, siphon off
